titleStmt.title: Excceding [sic] certain and true newes from Munster, Lemster, Waxford, Ulster, Conough, Tiperarey, and Dublin; otherwise called the English Pale. Being the true copie of a letter sent from a marchant in Dublin, a man well knowne in London, one Captaine Scout, a Dutch-man, living on the marchants key, neer Sir Willaim Parsons, one of the Lord Justices of Ireland to his worthy friend Mr. Van-Hooker. Bearing date, January 2. 1643.
titleStmt.author: Skout, J.

publicationStmt.publisher: January 9. Printed by T. Fawcett, for J. B.,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
